chapter.title: Help
chapter.para: The Help pages provide access to the full suite of documentation and support available to &susemgr; users. Click Help in the Overview category to see a list of options available to you.

sect1.title: &susemgr; &mgrinstguide;
sect1.para: The &mgrinstguide; provides detailed information regarding &susemgr; server and its installation and initial configuration. Implementing a fully functional &susemgr; requires more than installing software and a database. Client systems must be configured to use &susemgr;. Custom packages and channels should be created for optimal use. Since these tasks extend beyond the basic installation, they are covered in detail in other guides, as well as the &susemgr; Installation Guide.

sect1.title: &susemgr; &mgruserguide;
sect1.para: The &susemgr; &mgruserguide; leads through common use cases and explains the Web interface and its extensive features in detail.

sect1.title: &susemgr; &mgrproxyquick;
sect1.para: &susemgr; Proxy Server is a package-caching mechanism that reduces the bandwidth requirements. Proxy customers cache RPMs, such as patch updates from &suse; or custom RPMs generated by their organization, on an internal, centrally-located server. Client systems then receive these updates from the proxy rather than by accessing the &susemgr; server individually. The &susemgr; &mgrproxyquick; explains how to install and set up a &susemgr; Proxy Server.

sect1.title: &susemgr; &mgrrefguide;
sect1.para: The &mgrrefguide; page takes you to the document you are reading. It provides the most comprehensive set of instructions for using &susemgr;. Note that links to other technical guides may also appear in the left navigation bar, depending on the entitlement level and product offering of the account with which you are logged in.

sect1.title: &susemgr; &mgrclientconfguide;
sect1.para: By default, all &sle; client systems are configured to communicate with &ncc;. When connecting clients to &susemgr;, many of these settings must be altered. Changing client settings for a system or two may be relatively simple. A large enterprise environment containing hundreds or thousands of systems will benefit from the mass reconfiguration steps described in the &susemgr; &mgrclientconfguide;.
The Client Configuration Guide is a best practices manual intended to help customers of &susemgr; configure their client systems.

sect1.title: Release Notes
sect1.para: The Release Notes page lists the notes accompanying every recent release of &susemgr;. All significant changes occurring in a given release cycle, from major enhancements to the user interface to changes in the related documentation are documented here.

sect1.title: Search
sect1.para: The Documentation Search page features a robust search engine that indexes and searches &susemgr; documentation.
Users can search the available online documentation and filter them according to the following choices in the What to Search drop-down menu:

listitem.para: Content & Title — Search both the title heading or body content of all available documents.
Free Form — Search documents and indices for any keyword matches, which broadens search results.
Content — Search only the body content of documentation for more specific matches.
Title — Search only the title headings of the documentation for targeted, specific search results.

sect1.para: The Free Form field additionally allows you to search using field names that you prepend to search queries and filter results in that field.
For example, if you wanted to search all of the &susemgr; manuals for the word Virtualization in the title and install in the content, type the following in the Free Form field:
Other supported field names for documentation search include:

listitem.para: url — Search the URL for a particular keyword.
title — Search titles for a particular keyword.
content — Search the body of the documentation for a particular keyword.

sect1.para: If there are several pages of search results, you can limit the amount of visible results shown on one page by clicking the Display quantity items per page drop-down menu, which offers between 10 and 500 results per page.
To move between pages, click the right or left angle brackets (> to go forward or < to go backward).
